l1liutk6Text: REVIDA At-WoRC RELIEVE
l1liutk7Text:
Data from routine clinical practice show clinically
meaningful improvements† in functioning‡
in patients with MDD treated with Brintellix®§1
l1liutk8Text: Change from baseline in SDS scores at week 12 and week 24§
l1liutl5Text: Clinically meaningful change2
l1liutl6Text: Week 12 Week 24
l1liutl9Text:
Improvements in a real-world setting were also seen in depression
severity (as measured by PHQ-9), cognitive function (as measured
by PDQ-5 and DSST) and HRQoL (as measured by EQ-5D-5L)¶1

Brintellix_NewAss_342561680: <font style="color:#5e6b73; font-family: '5_SCCHXC+AvenirNextLTPro-Regular'; font-size:13px;">Clinically meaningful change<sup style="font-size:50%;">2</sup></font>
Brintellix_NewAss_3bc526093:
• Improvements in a real-world setting were also seen in depression
severity (as measured by PHQ-9), cognitive function (as measured
by PDQ-5 and DSST) and HRQoL (as measured by EQ-5D-5L)¶1
Brintellix_NewAss_37f14f068:
†Improvements of ≥4 points in total score and between 1-2 in subscale scores are considered clinically meaningful.2
‡As measured by SDS.
§Analysis of data based on non-interventional, multi-national, prospective cohort study in 737 outpatients initiating treatment with
Brintellix® for MDD. SDS baseline scores: SDS total score = 19.6, SDS work/school score = 6.3, SDS family life/home responsibilities
score = 6.6, SDS social life score = 6.7.
***p<0.001 vs baseline.
EQ-5D-5L, EuroQoL 5 dimension 5 level; DSST, digit symbol substitution test; HRQoL, health-related quality of life; LS, least square;
MDD, major depressive disorder; MDE: major depressive episode; PDQ-5, perceived deficits questionnaire – depression 5-item
version; PHQ-9, patient health questionnaire 9-item version; SDS, Sheehan disability scale.
Brintellix_NewAss_3216c4b14:
1.
2.
Brintellix_NewAss_36ab181b0:
Mattingly G et al. Poster presented at ECNP. P.0724. 2021.
Sheehan KH, Sheehan DV. Int Clin Psychopharmacol 2008;23:70-83.
Brintellix_NewAss_3d7c21a5e:
The proportion of patients whose functioning† was severely
impaired decreased from 52% to 15%, after 24 weeks of treatment
with Brintellix®‡1
Brintellix_NewAss_37a7ee106:
Change in overall functioning (SDS total score categories§)
over 24 weeks in routine clinical practice
Brintellix_NewAss_3fe45482b: Patients in SDS category (%)
Brintellix_NewAss_30f5a8018:
Baseline
Week 12

Brintellix_NewAss_3a14ea204: • In routine clinical practice, almost 3 in 4 patients with MDD (74%) present with co-morbidities¶1
Brintellix_NewAss_349d7acef: Level of functional impairment
Brintellix_NewAss_3c378f9cc:
†As measured by SDS.
‡Analysis of data based on non-interventional, multi-national, prospective cohort study in 737 outpatients initiating treatment with Brintellix® for MDD. Inclusion criteria aged ≥18 years and current MDE.
§Scores of 0-5, 6-11, 12-20 and 21-30 represent cut-off ranges of minimally, mildly, moderately, and markedly affected categories, respectively.1,2
¶Patients presented various comorbidities at study initiation, including sleep disorders (22%), cardiovascular disease (16.7%), chronic pain (8.5%), diabetes
(7.2%), chronic fatigue (6.1%), neurological disorder (6.0%), smoking (4.7%). SDS baseline scores: SDS total score = 19.6.
SDS, Sheehan disability scale.

1. Mattingly G et al. Poster presented at ECNP. P.0724. 2021.
2. Sheehan KH, Sheehan DV. Int Clin Psychopharmacol 2008;23:70-83.

Brintellix_NewAss_3c980602c: <font style="color:#e88200; font-family: '5_SCCHXC+AvenirNextLTPro-Regular'; font-size:12px;">Second treatment for current MDE (n=257)</font>
Brintellix_NewAss_30f0c57ce: <font style="color:#569099; font-family: '5_SCCHXC+AvenirNextLTPro-Regular'; font-size:12px;">Third or later treatment for current MDE (n=159)</font>
Brintellix_NewAss_37e3163ff:
• Patients may benefit from early initiation of Brintellix®, as shown across various measures,
compared to its use as a second or third treatment in a current MDE1
Brintellix_NewAss_32c10c9fd:
*p<0.001 vs baseline.
†Analysis of data based on non-interventional, multi-national, prospective cohort study in 737 outpatients initiating treatment with Brintellix® for MDD. SDS
baseline scores: SDS total score = 19.6, SDS work/school score = 6.3, SDS family life/home responsibilities score = 6.6, SDS social life score = 6.7.
DSST, digit symbol substitution test; EQ-5D-5L, EuroQoL 5-dimension, 5-level; HRQoL, health-related quality of life; MDD, major depressive disorder; MDE, major
depressive episode; PDQ-D-5, perceived deficits questionnaire – depression 5-item version; PHQ-9, patient health questionnaire 9-item version; SDS, Sheehan
disability scale.

1. Mattingly G et al. Poster presented at ECNP. P.0724. 2021.
